profile_positions.description:
Work in the marketing function and responsible for the positioning of Styron plastic products at a number of key European automotive OEM's. Attain full technical release against material specification requirements.
Work together with materials and component engineering functions at the OEM and Tiers, and formulate future trends in materials and component technologies.
Work with the R&D function within Styron to develop new products identifed to fit future needs / requirements.
Prepare and update account plans for responsible automotive OEM's in Europe, and set five year strategy planning.
Manage vehicle programme projects as project leader within Styron organisation, for product nomination and validation for applications on new vehicles up to start of production, and support the handover process to sales function to run the business.
Maintain project pipeline for next 3 years.
profile_positions.title: Snr. Application Development Engineer

Positioned Dow products and technologies at key European automotive manufacturers.
Managed the validation of materials in applications on new vehicle programmes
Managed the support from technical service and development function to develop new products where required in order to meet OEM material specifications, and to support tooling trials toward part validation.

profile_positions.title: Snr. Application Development Engineer

profile_positions.description:
I joined Dow Automotive in the TS&D department as the focal point for follow source projects, where material validated by an automotive OEM at source on new applications was required in another regions around the world where the vehicle would be built.  I developed a new work process in accordance with QS-9000 (later ISO TS16949) and managed several follow source projects in China, Brazil, South Africa and Europe.  The process was designed to validate the manufacture of global products in a local region, and included the technical and commercial release of locally available raw materials compliant with Dow standards. I also audited local testing facilities compliant with Dow standards, and designed a round robin test procedure using a reference material for periodic testing.
I was also responsible for providing technical support for key European OEM's and developed a number of new polypropylene products to meet exacting OEM requirements.  Technical service support also included ABS, PC, PC/ABS materials manufactured by Dow.
profile_positions.title: Snr. Technical Service & Development Engineer

profile_positions.description: I managed the compounded polypropylene value centre in South Africa after the former Hoechst Plastics devision under Plastomark was acquired by Dow Southern Africa in 1999.  My responsibilities included sales, technical service and development and product marketing.  I prepared periodic sales reports, was a member of the local value centre management team, and generated quarterly business reports to management.
profile_positions.title: Industry Leader - Compounded Polypropylene

profile_positions.description:
I joined the Hoechst plastics division Plastomark to learn about the fascinating field of plastics and brought my knowledge and experience of the automotive industry.  I received formal training, first by completing a certificate in plastics technology (3 modules: Materials, Supervisory Management and Injection Moulding Processing) through the Plastics Federation of South Africa, and thereafter a National Diploma in plastics technology through the Pretoria Technikon (3 - year diploma course).  I developed more than 15 new polypropylene compounds for automotive applications, including inter alia bumper fascias, door panels, interior trim components, and HVAC housings for Toyota, Honda, Volkswagen and General Motors.  I applied in several cases unique technologies for polypropylene compounds to meet the exacting standards set by the respective OEM, and utilised full factorial design models in the development of those products.  I also lead the evaluation and validation processes through the OEM to attain full approval and release of these products in new vehicles applications.  This included running injection moulding trials in new and existing tools on equipment up to 4500 tones clamping force for part evaluation and testing.

In the mid 1990's I was nominated as representative for Plastomark in the Hoechst works council, and later nominated to represent the Hoechst SA head office as site representative in negotiations with management on employee matters, annual salary reviews, performance award system, etc, and remained in this position until the final break up of Hoechst in 1999.  I also consulted with legal representation on changing legislation in South African labour law and the application thereof in various matters.
profile_positions.title: Technical Group Leader

profile_positions.description:
I worked in the Honda local content development department and was responsible for the local content development and procurement of locally manufactured trim components for Honda Civic (locally badged as the Ballade) model codes SC9 and SH4, built under license to Honda Motor Company.  Locally developed components included inter alia seating, headliners, door panels, carpets, trunk trim, and exterior trim parts.  For seating I applied static structural loads to design and develop steel frames, and orthopaedic and ergonomic design principles, and developed seats to suit the comfort range for 95 and 50 percentile SAE manikin requirements.
I also designed plastic trim parts which included emblems, reflectors, wheel trims, spoilers,etc, and utilised a variety of different materials including PPO, ABS, AES, and self skinning semirigid PU.
profile_positions.title: Development & Procurement Engineer

profile_positions.description:
I worked in the product design department for commercial vehicles and prepared layout design and detailed engineering drawings of chassis components, floor pans, exhaust systems, etc for Mercedes-Benz commercial vehicles built in South Africa.  Successes included the layout design and detailed drawing for a M-B 1928 chassis cross member to support an Allison automatic gearbox and a floor pan for an omnibus.
I also prepared design and detailed drawings for locally manufactured parts for Mercedes-Benz passenger cars and for Honda (manufactured under license).
profile_positions.title: Design Draughtsman

profile_positions.description: I prepared design and detailed component drawings for local manufactured parts on Mazda, Mitsubishi and Peugeot vehicles manufactured in South Africa at Sigma Motor Corporation under license to the respective parent companies.  Sigma Motor Corporation was acquired by Ford South Africa in the late 1980's and today build Mazda and Ford vehicles.  I reported to the chief draughtsman in the product engineering drawing office.
profile_positions.title: Detail Draughtsman

profile_positions.description:
Technician engineer's apprenticeship accredited by the Engineering Industry Training Board.  I completed my final year in the Product Design Office and specialised in vehicle suspension component design under the mentorship of a senior design engineer.
I won the EITB Apprentice Of The Year award in 1977 and from Automotive Products Ltd in the same year.
profile_positions.title: Technician Apprentice
